intro: Cryptantha tenuis, commonly known as the slender cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in early spring. The plant has slender, upright stems and small, narrow leaves, adapted to thrive in rocky or sandy soils. It produces pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Cryptantha tenuis is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands.
